document_name_accent: ung thu vu giai doan dau.json
document_title: Early stage (early) breast cancer: Symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: ung-thu-vu-giai-doan-dau.json_2_Symptoms of early stage breast cancer
subsection_content:
According to Dr. Khiem, early-stage breast cancer symptoms are often unclear. But if present, early breast cancer symptoms may include:
Breast swelling; Pain in any part of the breast; Appearance of a lump under the armpit or in the breast; Pain in the nipple area; Breast skin shows signs of depression or contraction; Redness around the nipple area or breast skin; Abnormal nipple discharge; Change in size or shape of the breast
“Breast cancer often presents as a painless lump or thickening in the breast. It is important that when detecting an unusual tumor in the breast, women should immediately go to the hospital for examination, not delaying more than 1-2 months even if there is no pain," Dr. Khiem noted.
See more: 5 stages of breast cancer that women need to understand in detail.
